front.p: 1840 July 3: to Freeman ATL MS-0585. From typed copy.

body.p: I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of yr. official Letter of the 30th. ult. in which you desire to be informed as to my willingness to chge. myself with the Paihia and Waimate Letters for distribn., &c.

In answer to which, I beg to state:—That I shod. be most happy at all times to do any thing in my power for the Public Benefit (consistent with my duty as a Missy. and Servt. of the C.M.S.)—and, if, Letters for Paihia and Waimate only (with the addn. of those for the Mission generally) without the Letters, &c., for the Hokga. District be intended—I shod be quite willing to take on myself the chge. of recg. them. It must however be understood, that I am often, when engd. in travellg. among the Natives, necessarily from home; and, that I have not the least ambition to be gazetted as a post office keeper.

I have the honor to be, Sir,
Yr. mo. ob. servt.
